triples.name: Community structure
triples.relevance: The paper addresses community partition/detection as the core problem being solved in social networks.

triples.name: Information cascade
triples.relevance: The Independent Cascade model for influence propagation in social networks is a foundational concept used in the paper.

triples.name: Social influence
triples.relevance: Understanding how influence propagates through social networks is fundamental to the influence maximization objective.

triples.name: Greedy algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper devises both continuous and discrete greedy algorithms as novel approaches to solve the community partition problem.

triples.name: Submodular set function
triples.relevance: Submodularity analysis is used to construct a submodular lower bound for the sandwich framework.

triples.name: Supermodular function
triples.relevance: Supermodularity analysis is used to construct a supermodular upper bound for the sandwich framework.

triples.name: Social network
triples.relevance: Social networks are the primary application domain for the proposed community partition algorithm.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory provides the mathematical foundation for analyzing network topology and community structure.

triples.name: NP-hardness
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes the NP-hardness of the influence maximization for community partition problem.

triples.name: Approximation algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper proposes approximation algorithms with proven 1-1/e approximation ratios for solving the NP-hard problem.
